main event: On 9th October 1955 in Glenwood, Iowa, a round object the size of a dime held at arm's length was observed. It appeared white, and it was seen in the west before disappearing in the south. The object seemed to shift to the right and then to the left.
interesting points: The object was described as round, similar to the size of a dime, and appeared white.
It was observed for a duration of 3 minutes before disappearing in the south.
The conclusion drawn was that it was possibly a balloon, based on the duration of the sighting and the movement of the object.
No photographs were taken of the object despite the observation.
The sighting was classified as 'probably astronomical' based on the movements and appearance.
